ray.surface

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.surface.Surface
      • ray.surface.Sphere

  • public class Sphere
extends Surface
    Represents a sphere as a center and a radius.
    Author:
    ags

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sphere

        public Sphere()
        Default constructor, creates a sphere at the origin with radius 1.0

      • Sphere

        public Sphere(Vector3 newCenter,
              double newRadius,
              Material newMaterial)
        The explicit constructor. This is the only constructor with any real code in it. Values should be set here, and any variables that need to be calculated should be done here.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - The center of the new sphere.
        newRadius - The radius of the new sphere.
        newMaterial - The material of the new sphere.

      • chooseSamplePoint

        public boolean chooseSamplePoint(Point3 p,
                                 Point2 seed,
                                 LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)
        Description copied from class: Surface
        Choose a random point to sample illumination from this surface as an emitter.
        Specified by:
        chooseSamplePoint in class Surface
        Parameters:
        p - a point where the emitted ray pointing to
        seed - seed used to generate a random point on the surface
        lRec - the output information about the illumination
        Returns:
        true if success

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(IntersectionRecord outRecord,
                         Ray ray)
        Description copied from class: Surface
        Tests this surface for intersection with ray. If an intersection is found record is filled out with the information about the intersection and the method returns true. It returns false otherwise and the information in outRecord is not modified.
        Specified by:
        intersect in class Surface
        Parameters:
        outRecord - the output IntersectionRecord
        ray - the ray to intersect
        Returns:
        true if the surface intersects the ray
        See Also:
        Surface.intersect(ray.misc.IntersectionRecord, ray.misc.Ray)
